author: onezerozeroone
body:
BlackRock added BB to its iShares Digital Security UCITS fund.

Third largest holding with a 1.97% weighting and a market value of $28.6M

Only DXC and WIPRO with market caps of 10.4B and 41.3B have a higher weighting in the fund. DOCU is only #9 in terms of their holdings.

author: Extremely-Bad-Idea
body: Hewlett Packard has been disappointing investors for 20 years.  HP was the original Silicon Valley company, founded in a garage in 1939.  It did great until around 2000, then the disappointments became unending.  They bought Compaq and EDS.  They split into HPE and HPQ.  They spun off DXC Technology.  Nothing worked in terms of energizing their product lines, revenue, or profitability.  Stay away, stay far away, LOL

author: dhilowitz3
body: Adding to CC, CIR, DXC, AMCX, EBIX, AND OC on any weakness!

author: dhilowitz3
body: CC and VIAC are two of my favorites!  Also looking for AMCX, CIR, DXC, OC and TEVA to run
